STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 26, 2025
Lauren M Skinner
WOLVERINE CENTER
2629 LENOX ST,
DETROIT, MI, 48215-2667
Re: License #: CI820201513
SI #: 2025SIC0000194
Dear Lauren M Skinner:
Attached is the Amended Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***Amended***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000194
Special Investigation Intake Date: December 10, 2024
License #: CI820201513
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: Lauren M Skinner
Agency Name: WOLVERINE CENTER
Agency Address: 2629 LENOX ST
DETROIT, MI 48215-2667
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/30/2025
Capacity: 23
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
12/11/2024 Email Other
12/13/202 Onsite Inspection Special Investigation Initiation
12/13/2024 Face to Face Interview
12/13/2024 Face to Face Interview
12/13/2024 Phone Other
12/17/2024 Face to Face Interview
12/19/2024 Face to Face Interview
01/06/2025 Face to Face Interview
01/09/2025 Face to Face Interview
01/09/2025 Video Conference MIC Pre-Disposition Meeting
III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Section follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
Description forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/27/24, a staff member got into a youth's face, pushed the
youth, and slammed him into a wall. The staff member picked up
the youth and pushed the youth in to a windowsill, causing the
youth to hurt their back.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was held with Chief
Administrator at Wolverine Center. The DHHS specialist was
also present. She was made aware of the allegations and she
advised that she had no knowledge of the incident. She reported
there were no incident reports relative to the allegations. She
further advised that the agency would immediately place Staff 1
on administrative leave. A request was made for the face sheets
for youth involved, any incident reports and video footage for the
incident date of 11/27/2024 (2nd shift).
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at
Wolverine Center. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth
A reported approximately one month ago, at nighttime on
11/27/2024 he observed another resident, Youth B, being defiant.
Youth A recalled that Staff 1 grabbed the top of Youth B’s shirt
and told him to “chill” as he was running around and not following
directions. Youth A denied that the staff choked or was physical
with Youth B. Youth B calmed down and went to his room. Youth
A stated he did not like how Staff 1 was treating Youth B so he
told Staff 1 to "calm the fuck down". Youth A stated he was then
told to go to his room by Staff 1 but could not because Youth C
was standing in his way. Youth A admitted he was frustrated and
yelled out “I can’t get into my fucking room”. He reported that
Youth C moved and he then entered his room and was followed
by Staff 1. Youth A recalled that he was upset and pushed the
dresser against the wall. He reported that Staff 1 told him to “chill
the fuck out” and pointed his finger into his face. Youth A told
Staff 1 to get his finger out of his face and pushed him. He
2

reported that Staff 1 continued to point his finger at him and he
asked him two times to get his finger out of his face. Youth A
stated Staff 1 then pushed him aggressively into the window/wall
in his room. He stated his back hit the wall or window ledge and
caused him pain. He further stated that Staff 1 picked him up by
his shirt with two hands (while his feet remained on the floor) and
slammed him against the window. He described hearing a "pop" in
his back and screamed for Staff 1 to let him go. Youth A reported
Staff 1 said something to him, but he does not remember what it
was. Staff 1 then left the room. Youth A reported that Staff 2 and
Staff 4 were present. Youth A denied any visible injuries or
bruises at the time but stated he felt pain in his back after the
incident. Youth A denied experiencing or witnessing any other
incidents of abuse involving Staff 1 or other staff members. He
stated he discussed the incident with Staff 1, and they are now
"cool".
On 12/13/2024 a telephone call was held with DHHS Specialist.
She advised that she had spoken with the Foster Care Worker
(FCW) and he reported Youth A reported to him on 12/09/2024
that Staff 1 had thrown him against the wall causing his back to
hurt on the day it happened, but it did not remain hurting. Youth A
did not disclose when the incident occurred.
On 12/14/2024 a voicemail message was left for the FCW
requesting a return call with any concerns relative to placement of
Youth A at Wolverine.
On 12/14/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional concerns.
The following interviews took place at Wolverine on
12/19/2024 along with the DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. He reported he has
worked for the agency for three months and is employed as a
youth specialist. Staff 1 stated he did not recall a lot of the
specifics from 11/27/2024, but confirmed he was on shift that day.
He denied that the allegations were true. He denied having any
incidents involving Youth A, pointing his finger in any resident's
face, physically abusing or assaulting any residents, pushing or
assaulting Youth A. Staff 1 reported that he does not recall any
incidents involving Youth A. He denied working on the same unit,
being on the 3rd floor or having any contact with Tristian on the
day of the alleged incident. Staff 1 denied ever putting his finger
3

in the face of Youth A. He stated he does not discipline residents
when they misbehave and that he contacts the supervisors
whenever there is an issue with a resident. Lastly, Staff 1 denied
seeing any staff be physically inappropriate with Youth A or any
youth in the facility.
An interview was completed with Staff 2. She has been employed
at the agency since October as a youth specialist. Staff 2 recalled
working on the same unit with Staff 1 on 11/27/2024 and worked a
double shift. She did not witness any incident or altercation
between Staff 1 and Youth A but reported that Staff 1 told her that
Youth A pushed him and also attempted to fight him. She did not
know the specific details of what occurred or where it occurred.
She did recall Youth A going into his bedroom, throwing items
such as his dresser and “destroying” his room. Staff 2 denied ever
seeing any staff physically abuse or improperly restrain any
residents.
An interview was held with Chief Administrator. A request was
made for any incident reports or documentation relative to Youth A
throwing his dresser or destroying his room. She reported she
does not recall any incident of Youth A destroying his room and
there is no documentation for that. She suggested that the video
footage would show that Staff 1 was never on unit three.
An interview of Youth B was completed. He was interviewed in
his bedroom on the third floor. He resided on the same unit as
Youth A. He reported he was present on the day of the incident
and he thinks it occurred around 8:30pm. He recalled that Youth
A was upset and throwing things in his room. He denied
knowledge of why Youth A was upset. He reported Youth A threw
his dresser and Staff 1 went into his room. Youth A pushed Staff
1 and Staff 1 pushed him back, causing Youth A to fall into the
dresser. Youth B denied any incidents occurring between him and
Staff 1. He denied that Staff 1 grabbed his shirt or forced him to
go to his room. He described Staff 1 as “nice” and denied he ever
hit or choked him. Youth B denied seeing Staff 1 involved in any
other physical incidents involving youth at Wolverine.
An interview was completed with Staff 4. He advised that he has
been employed with the agency for about one year and is a shift
supervisor. He confirmed he was working at the facility on
11/27/2024 from 2pm to 10pm. He reported working on unit three
with Youth A. He denied that Staff 1 was working on the third
floor. He denied knowledge of any incident with Staff 1 and Youth
A. He denied that he witnessed any incidents with Youth A and
4

any other youth or staff. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 1 use any
type of physical discipline with Youth A or any other youth. He
also denied seeing Staff 1 point his finger at Youth A.
On 01/06/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
C. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth C confirmed
that his room is across from Youth A’s room. He recalled that he
was present the day of the incident, which he remembered as the
day before Thanksgiving. He recalled hearing noises in the hall,
but did not see what had happened. He reported he heard yelling
but did not know who it was or what was said. Youth C denied
standing in the doorway of Youth A and denied seeing Staff 1
enter the room of Youth A. He identified Staff 1 as “cool” and
denied having any issue or concerns with him. He denied seeing
Staff 1 or any staff at Wolverine hurt or inappropriately discipline
any residents.
On 01/09/2025 a DHHS Pre-Dispositional Case Closing meeting
was held. The DHHS specialist advised no findings of abuse or
neglect were noted.
Documents Reviewed:
WHHS Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur.
Medical Report of Youth A:
A medical record dated 11/28/2024 was reviewed from Ascension
St. John Hospital in Detroit, MI, documenting an examination
conducted on November 28, 2024. He presented to the
emergency room for evaluation of back pain. Patient was
examined and no concerns were noted. Youth A was given Motrin
during the visit, after which he reported feeling significantly better.
He was discharged back to the facility with a prescription for 600
mg Ibuprofen.
WHHS Behavior Notification:
5

Dated for 11/28/2024 and indicated that Youth A reported his back
was hurting. It was noted that Youth A has a history of scoliosis.
He was transported to the hospital at 9:45am.
Tour of Facility:
A tour of unit three and the bedroom was completed. At the time
of the tour, there were no area of concerns noted. Youth A was
able to identify the dresser and windowsill that he reported the
staff pushed he up against.
SW Contact of DHHS Specialist:
Contact via telephone was made with Staff 3, the therapist for
Youth A. The following information was reported by Staff 3: On
November 29th, 2024, in the afternoon (exact time unknown),
Youth A informed Staff 3 that on November 27th, 2024, Staff 1
pushed him into the window in his bedroom, causing him to hurt
his back. Youth A reported the incident occurred because he
became upset with Staff 1 for speaking rudely to another resident,
whose name he did not disclose. Youth A stated that he pointed
his finger in Staff 1’s face, after which Staff 1 pushed him into the
window. Staff 3 stated he was not present during the incident and
could not describe how Staff 1 pushed Youth A into the window.
Staff 3 denied having any prior concerns regarding Staff 1 and
stated that no other residents have reported concerns or incidents
involving him. Staff 3 also stated that he has never witnessed
Staff 1 physically abuse or harm any residents.
Staff 3 called again about three hours later stated he was at the
car dealership earlier when he first talked to the DHHS Specialist.
He stated he was not told the information from Youth A until
12/02/2024, which was Monday. He stated the original date he
provided was incorrect. He further stated he does not actually
know what occurred. He was asked if he reported to Chief
Administrator the same date he was made aware and he stated
he thinks so but is not sure. He was asked why his story changed
and he stated he "thought it was something different”.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with this licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with both staff and youth. Two of the youth interviewed reported
that Youth A was pushed by the staff in his room, however staff
interviewed had no recollection of the incident. It has been
assessed that there is not sufficient evidence to confirm that the
behavior occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 (1) An institution shall establish and follow
Section written health service policies and procedures addressing all of
Description the following: (a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth was denied the option to go to the hospital upon
request, and was not taken until the next day.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at
Wolverine Center. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth
A stated Staff 1 pushed him aggressively into the window/wall in
his room. He stated his back hit the wall or window ledge and
caused him pain. He further stated that Staff 1 picked him up by
his shirt with two hands (while his feet remained on the floor) and
slammed him against the window. He described hearing a "pop" in
his back and screamed for Staff 1 to let him go. Youth A reported
telling a staff that his back hurt and requested to go to the hospital
on the night of the incident. He could not remember which staff
member he informed, but he mentioned that Staff 4 told him he
would send him to the hospital but did not. Youth A denied any
visible injuries or bruises at the time but stated he felt pain in his
back after the incident.
On 12/13/2024 a telephone call was held with DHHS Specialist.
She advised that she had spoken with the FCW and he stated he
was concerned because Youth A had reported to him on
12/09/2024 that he was not taken to the doctor to be examined
after asking staff several times to take him to the doctor because
his back was in pain.
The following interviews took place at Wolverine on
12/19/2024 along with the DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. He stated he did not
recall a lot of the specifics from 11/27/2024, but confirmed he was
on shift that day. Staff 1 denied Youth A ever requested to see a
doctor or reported that his back was hurting.
7

An interview was completed with Staff 2. Staff 2 recalled working
on the same unit with Staff 1 on 11/27/2024 and worked a double
shift. She denied recalling Youth A reporting that his back hurt or
requesting to go to the hospital.
An interview of Youth B was completed. He interviewed in his
bedroom on the third floor. He reported he was present on the day
of the incident and he thinks it occurred around 8:30pm. Youth B
reported that Staff 4 was on the unit and Youth A asked Staff 4 if
he could go to the doctor because his back was hurt. Youth B
reported that Youth A was sent to the hospital. When asked how
did he know that Youth A went to the hospital, he said because
Youth A left the unit.
An interview was completed with Staff 4. He confirmed he was
working at the facility on 11/27/2024 from 2pm to 10pm. He
confirmed that Youth A reported to him that his back was hurting,
but did not say why it was hurting and did not request to go to the
hospital. Staff 4 reported Youth A was asked if he wanted to go to
the hospital to be examined since he stated his back was hurting
and he declined. Staff 4 reported Youth A was given a Tylenol.
Documents Reviewed:
Medical Report of Youth A:
A medical record dated 11/28/2024 was reviewed from Ascension
St. John Hospital in Detroit, MI, documenting an examination
conducted on November 28, 2024. He presented to the
emergency room for evaluation of back pain. Patient was
examined and no concerns were noted. Youth A was given Motrin
during the visit, after which he reported feeling significantly better.
He was discharged back to the facility with a prescription for 600
mg Ibuprofen.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed. Medical documentation supports the youth received
medical treatment within 24 hours.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code R 400.4109 Program statement
Title
Rule Code & Rule 109. (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Section program statement which specifically addresses all of the
Description following: (c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
8

care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation The agency failed to write an incident report.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was held with Chief
Administrator at Wolverine Center. The DHHS specialist was
also present. She was made aware of the allegations and she
advised that she had no knowledge of the incident. She reported
there were no incident reports relative to the allegations.
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A. He reported that an incident occurred between him and Staff 1.
He also reported that when he was upset her threw some of the
items in his room.
On 12/19/2024 an interview was completed with Staff 2 at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. She did not
witness any incident or altercation between Staff 1 and Youth A
but reported that Staff 1 told her that Youth A pushed him and also
attempted to fight him. She did not know the specific details of
what occurred or where it occurred. She did recall Youth A going
into his bedroom, throwing items such as his dresser and
“destroying” his room.
On 12/19/2024 an interview was held with Chief Administrator at
Wolverine. The DHHS Specialist was also present. A request
was made for any incident reports or documentation relative to
Youth A throwing his dresser or destroying his room. She
reported she does not recall any incident of Youth A destroying his
room and there is no documentation for that.
On 12/19/2024 an interview of Youth B was completed at
Wolverine. The DHHS Specialist was also present. He reported
he was present on the day of the incident and he thinks it occurred
around 8:30pm. He recalled that Youth A was upset and throwing
things in his room. He denied knowledge of why Youth A was
upset. He reported Youth A threw his dresser and Staff 1 went
into his room.
Documents Reviewed:
9

Wolverine Incident Reporting Policy – It is the agency policy to
ensure safe, effective and transparent response to incidents of
critical nature. This policy must be consistently complied with in
order to facilitate communication and timely response from the
appropriate individuals. The list provides a guideline, but is not an
exhaustive list of incidents deemed critical. The lead staff
managing the incident is responsible for completing the
appropriate Incident Report in a clear, complete and accurate
manner. The appropriate form should be used to document the
incident, either the Incident Report Form or the Behavior
notification form. The policy provides some guidelines for when
an incident form or behavior notification form should be completed
(i.e. physical injury, AWOL, Arrest, Vehicle Accident, Suicidal
Behaviors/Gestures, Criminal Behavior and more). It specifies the
list is a guide and not an exhaustive list.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found in
non-compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed, and it was reported that an incident occurred that
should have been documented in the form of an incident report or
behavior notification. The agency failed to properly document the
event.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0001082SI CAP Approved 04/05/2024
2024SIC0001583 CAP Approved 10/21/2024
2024SIC0001650 CAP Approved 12/13/2024
2024SIC0001539 CAP Approved 11/14/2024
Rule Code Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Title required.
Rule Code & The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to assure
Section compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL
Description 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Staff failed to make an immediate report of suspected abuse or
neglect as required per agency policy.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/13/2024 an in-person interview was held with Chief
Administrator at Wolverine Center. The DHHS specialist was
10

also present. She was made aware of the allegations and she
advised that she had no knowledge of the incident between Staff 1
and Youth A.
01/06/2024 an interview was completed with Program Manager
at Wolverine Center. DHHS Specialist was also present.
Program Manager was asked if the agency made a report of
suspected abuse and neglect relative to the alleged incident
between Youth A and Staff 1 prior to DHHS and DCWL
involvement and she responded she was not aware and would
have to check.
Documents Reviewed:
Review of SW Contact of DHHS Specialist:
Contact via telephone was made with Staff 3, the therapist for
Youth A. The following information was reported by Staff 3: On
11/29/2024, in the afternoon (exact time unknown), Youth A
informed Staff 3 that on 11/27/2024, Staff 1 pushed him into the
window in his bedroom, causing him to hurt his back. Staff 3
reported the incident immediately to Chief Administrator. He
stated Chief Administrator informed him that she would file a CPS
report. Staff 3 is unsure if Chief Administrator or anyone at the
agency filed a CPS report. He did not follow up with the Chief
Administrator to confirm the report was made.
Staff 3 called again about three hours later and stated the original
date he provided was incorrect. He stated he was not told the
information from Youth A until 12/02/2024, which was Monday.
He stated he thought he was asked if he reported to Chief
Administrator the same date but was not sure.
The CI complaint was reviewed. It was noted that the intake date
for the investigation is dated for 12/10/2024.
Medical Report of Youth A:
A medical record dated 11/28/2024 was reviewed from Ascension
St. John Hospital in Detroit, MI, documenting an examination
conducted on November 28, 2024. He presented to the
emergency room with Wolverine Staff for evaluation of back pain.
Medical report documents that youth reported he got into an
altercation with Wolverine Staff and was thrown into a wall.
Patient was examined and no concerns were noted. Youth A was
given Motrin during the visit, after which he reported feeling
significantly better. He was discharged back to the facility with a
prescription for 600 mg Ibuprofen.
11

Chief Administrator 2 participated in an exit conference by video
with the consultant and area manager on 3/25/25. She reported
she was not in her role when this investigation started. She also
reported the facility was not provided the above information from
the hospital regarding Youth A reporting he was thrown against a
wall by a staff member.
Wolverine Compliance with the CHILD PROTECTION LAW Act
238 of 1975 Policy – Policy indicates that mandated reporters are
required to make an immediate verbal report to CPS and a written
report within 72 hours when they suspect child abuse or neglect.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4131. The agency
failed to follow policy relevant to immediate mandated reporting of
suspected child abuse and neglect as evidenced by Staff 3’s
interview indicating Youth A reported the alleged abuse to him on
12/2/24, the medical paperwork from the hospital dated 11/28/24
which indicated a staff member was present when Youth A
alleged he was thrown against a wall by a staff member, and the
central intake complaint that was received on 12/10/25.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
03/25/2025 Amended
______________________________________________________________________
Cassandra Thomas Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:

12
